page.title: 17LOCAL PRESS
page.content: We looked at the local papers for the second half of June 1985 to see what were the main local,national and international concerns. There was much local concern about the fire at the Bradford City Football Club Ground which killed so many people.This has given rise to national worries about other grounds and stands which may be in a similar condition. Hooliganism at football grounds is also an area of concern at all three levels.The deaths of 38 people at the Heysel Stadium in Brussels has given rise to much consideration of what should be done. The hijacking of an aircraft at Beirut airport by Muslim gunmen and the explosion of the Air india airliner over the Atlantic have also occupied a lot of space in the press.
